result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek E Klemens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Straight-Time. 
Consecutive to Walworth County Revocation Sentence if imposed. 
39 days credit if revoked.
Consecutive to: Walworth County Revocation.
Concurrent with: Walworth County Revocation Sentence

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Meijer Store. Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
No contact with the Meijer store listed in the criminal complaint. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

10:449AM Defendant Derek E Klemens in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count 2.
Court finds defendant guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.

Recommendations by the State.
Recommendations by the Defense.
Statements by the Defendant.



Court orders the following:
6 months Jail STRAIGHT TIME.
Consecutive to Walworth County Revocation Sentence if imposed.
STAYED
39 days Credit IF REVOKED

Term of Probation: 1 year 
Concurrent to Walworth County Revocation Sentence.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: with Meijer store listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $99.98 to be paid to Meijer Store
COSTS:  $243.00
DRGOD: $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

10:23 AM Defendant Derek E Klemens in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Jensen is asking for a plea/sentencing date.  The Court will schedule this matter for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
